comments.creator: bruant.d@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; fr; rv:1.9.2.14) Gecko/20110221 Ubuntu/10.10 (maverick) Firefox/3.6.14
Build Identifier: 

We, people who are working torward "building a better web" should probably give the example and have a website that follow standards and best practices.
Here are a couple of technical inelegancies I have noticed:
* The form layout is table-based
* Two JS libraries (jQuery, YUI) with plugins are used. I think that such a small web page doesn't require that much.
* Empty cache page load: 14sec. Reload with cache: 7sec. This appears to me to be way to long for "just a form"
* Fonts download happens late in the process. It should be one of the first thing, because in some browsers, text won't render before font download (http://paulirish.com/2009/fighting-the-font-face-fout/).


Reproducible: Always
